sections.heading: This Act may be cited as the State Designations Act.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the State Designations Act.

sections.heading: State seal.
sections.text: State seal.

sections.heading: State bird.
sections.text:
The bird Cardinalis Cardinalis, commonly known as
the "Cardinal", is designated the official State Bird of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State insect.
sections.text:
The insect Danaus plexippus, commonly known as
the "Monarch Butterfly", is designated the official State insect of the
State of Illinois.

sections.heading: Official language.
sections.text:
The official language of
the State of Illinois is English.

sections.heading: State mineral.
sections.text:
The mineral calcium fluoride,
commonly called "fluorite", is designated the official State mineral of the
State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State rock. Dolostone is designated the official State rock of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State rock. Dolostone is designated the official State rock of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State slogan.
sections.text:
The slogan "Land of Lincoln"
is designated the official slogan of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State song.
sections.text:
The song "Illinois", words written by C. H.
Chamberlain and music composed by Archibald Johnston, is designated
the official State song of Illinois. The words and music of the song
are set forth at Laws 1925, pages 602 and 603, and are
incorporated into this Section by reference.

sections.heading: State tree and flower.
sections.text:
The white oak tree is designated the
native State tree of the State of Illinois; and the native violet is
designated the native State flower of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State wildflower. The plant Asclepias spp, commonly known as "Milkweed",   is designated  the official State wildflower of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State wildflower. The plant Asclepias spp, commonly known as "Milkweed", is designated the official State wildflower of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State animal.
sections.text:
The animal Odocoileus virginianus, commonly
known as the "white-tailed deer", is designated the official State animal
of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State pet. Shelter dogs and shelter cats that are residing in or have been adopted from a shelter or rescue facility in this State are designated as the official State pet of the State of Illinois
sections.text: State pet. Shelter dogs and shelter cats that are residing in or have been adopted from a shelter or rescue facility in this State are designated as the official State pet of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State fish.
sections.text:
The fish Lepomis macrochirus, commonly known as
the "Bluegill", is designated the official State fish of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State prairie grass.
sections.text:
The prairie grass Big Bluestem is
designated the official State prairie grass of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State vegetable. Sweet corn is designated as the official State vegetable of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State vegetable. Sweet corn is designated as the official State vegetable of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: Official State mushroom. The mushroom calvatia gigantea, commonly known as the "giant puffball", is designated the official State mushroom of the State of Illinois
sections.text: Official State mushroom. The mushroom calvatia gigantea, commonly known as the "giant puffball", is designated the official State mushroom of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State grain. Corn is designated as the official State grain of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State grain. Corn is designated as the official State grain of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State fruit. The fruit Malus xdomestica, commonly known as the "GoldRush Apple", is designated the official State fruit of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State fruit. The fruit Malus xdomestica, commonly known as the "GoldRush Apple", is designated the official State fruit of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State fossil.
sections.text:
The fossil Tullimonstrum gregarium is designated
the official State fossil of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State artifact. The pirogue is designated the official State artifact of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State artifact. The pirogue is designated the official State artifact of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State folk dance.
sections.text:
The dance known as the Square Dance is
designated the American Folk Dance of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State exercise. Cycling, the act of riding a bicycle for exercise, is designated the official State exercise of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State exercise. Cycling, the act of riding a bicycle for exercise, is designated the official State exercise of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State theatre. Theatre in the Park is designated as
sections.text: Illinois' Official State Theatre.

sections.heading: State soil.
sections.text:
The soil known as Drummer silty clay loam is
designated the official
State soil of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State snackfood.
sections.text:
Popcorn is designated the official State snackfood of the State of
Illinois.

sections.heading: State amphibian. The amphibian Ambystoma tigrinum, commonly known as the "Eastern Tiger Salamander", is designated the official State amphibian of the State of Illinois
sections.text: State amphibian. The amphibian Ambystoma tigrinum, commonly known as the "Eastern Tiger Salamander", is designated the official State amphibian of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State snake. The reptile Lampropeltis triangulum triangulum, commonly known as the "Eastern Milksnake", is designated the official State snake of the State of Illinois
sections.text: State snake. The reptile Lampropeltis triangulum triangulum, commonly known as the "Eastern Milksnake", is designated the official State snake of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State reptile. The reptile Chrysemys picta, commonly known as the "Painted Turtle", is designated the official State reptile of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State reptile. The reptile Chrysemys picta, commonly known as the "Painted Turtle", is designated the official State reptile of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State tartan. The Illinois Saint Andrew Society Tartan is designated the official tartan of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State tartan. The Illinois Saint Andrew Society Tartan is designated the official tartan of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State pie. Pumpkin pie is designated the official State pie of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State pie. Pumpkin pie is designated the official State pie of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: State microbe. Penicillium rubens NRRL 1951 is designated the official State microbe of the State of Illinois.
sections.text: State microbe. Penicillium rubens NRRL 1951 is designated the official State microbe of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: Prior law.
sections.text: Prior law.

sections.heading: Other Acts of the 87th General Assembly.
sections.text:
If any other Act of
the 87th General Assembly changes, adds, or repeals a provision of
prior law that is continued in this Act, then that change, addition, or
repeal in the other Act shall be construed together with this Act.

sections.heading: Official gubernatorial portraits.
sections.text: Official gubernatorial portraits.

sections.heading: Matters of form.
sections.text: Matters of form.

sections.heading: Home rule; mandates.
sections.text:
Nothing in this Act as initially
enacted (i) is a denial or limitation on home rule powers where no denial
or limitation existed under prior law or (ii) creates a State mandate under
the State Mandates Act where no mandate existed under prior law.

sections.heading: Repeals.
sections.text: Repeals.

sections.heading: of the Illinois State Agency Historic     Resources Preservation Act.
sections.text: of the Illinois State Agency Historic Resources Preservation Act.

sections.heading: Effective date.
sections.text: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
